Rule.Name: sPowerPointPR
Rule.Title: The build number for PpCore.dll indicates a Private Release (PR) build and this is an unsupported configuration
Rule.Text: The build number for PpCore.dll '{0}' indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use. Please install the latest publicly available update.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMPPT2007
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=12 and not($SKU2007='0011' or $SKU2007='0018' or $SKU2007='002E' or $SKU2007='0030') and not($SKU2007='')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMPPT2010
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Key4: Name LIKE '%Office 14, Office%' AND ProductKeyID LIKE '%%PID%%'

Rule.Name: sNoIRMPPT201064
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Key4: Name LIKE '%Office 14, Office%' AND ProductKeyID LIKE '%%PID%%'

Rule.Name: sNoIRMPPT2013
Rule.Query: contains('%PRODUCTCODE%','0FF1CE') and $n2DigitVersion=15 and not(($SKU2013='0011' and ($ReleaseType2013='1' or $ReleaseType2013='0')) or $SKU2013='0018')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMPPT201364
Rule.Query: contains('%PRODUCTCODE%','0FF1CE') and $n2DigitVersion=15 and not(($SKU201364='0011' and ($ReleaseType201364='1' or $ReleaseType201364='0')) or $SKU201364='0018')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMC2RPPT2013
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Name: Office 2013 Modern Authentication support for Office 365

Rule.Name: fKB2965206Installed
Rule.Text: {1} (or later) is{0}installed

Rule.Name: sAdalEnabled
Rule.Title: All prerequisites for ADAL are{0}installed

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerPowerPoint14
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: You have a version ({0}) of the PDFMaker add-in installed that is not compatible with PowerPoint. Please update the add-in to version 10 or higher. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerPowerPoint14x64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=14 and $bitness='x64' and versioncompare($.,'10.1.0.0')<0 and ($hkcuPDFMaker or $hklmPDFMaker or $hklmWowPDFMaker)
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: The Adobe PDFMaker add-in was found on a computer that also has a 64-bit install of Office. The PDFMaker add-in version you have ({0}) is not supported with 64-bit versions of Office. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerPowerPoint15
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: You have a version ({0}) of the PDFMaker add-in installed that is not compatible with PowerPoint. Please update the add-in to version 11.0.1 or higher. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayHKCU
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sPentarBarPPTAddin
Rule.Title: The CoPentaBar add-in is installed
Rule.Text: The CoPentaBar add-in is installed and it has been known to cause high CPU problems in PowerPoint 2013.

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayHKLM
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayWow
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sDisabledAddins
Rule.Title: Add-ins have been automatically disabled because of performance or stability issues
Rule.Text: PowerPoint add-ins have been disabled due to performance or stability issues. To see the list of disabled add-ins, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'Disabled Add-ins' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sUserReenabledAddins
Rule.Title: Problematic add-in(s) re-enabled by the user
Rule.Text: {0} add-in(s) disabled by PowerPoint because of performance or stability issues was/were re-enabled by the user. To see the list of disabled add-ins that were re-enabled by the user, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'DoNotDisableAddinList' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sDisableRobustifiedUNC
Rule.Title: DisableRobustifiedUNC=1
Rule.Text: This registry value is only intended for troubleshooting purpose and is not supported in production environment.

Rule.Name: sOfficeFileValidation
Rule.Text: The Office File Validation (OFV) is installed on the computer and configured to load
Rule.Title: The Office File Validation (OFV) is installed on the computer. Because the add-in is configured to process files when they are opened, these files may open more slowly than when the OFV add-in is not installed.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOff
Rule.Title: VBA functionality is impaired or disabled (HKCU registry data)
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value in the HKCU registry hive is set to a value other than 0. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOff
Rule.Title: Visual Basic for Applications is disabled (HKLM registry data)
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value = 1 in the registry under the HKLM hive. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA Functionality is impaired or disabled due to Policy under HKCU
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKCU. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA Functionality is impaired or disabled due to Policy under HKLM
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKLM. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Last PowerPoint crashes
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Last PowerPoint crashes

Rule.Name: bucketLookup
Rule.Title: Event 1001

Rule.Name: sPPTPowerPivotError
Rule.Title: Error found in the Office Alerts log was caused by the PowerPivot add-in
Rule.Text: An error found in the Office Alerts log indicated a problem saving a PowerPoint file. This problem can occur when the PowerPivot add-in is enabled.

Rule.Name: nError400184Count
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Message' and contains(Value,'controls on this presentation')])

Rule.Name: sBadPPTInterfaceReg1
Rule.Query: (((../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=true() and ../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2='']/Value!='_Presentation') or (../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=false()) and $bitness=$OSDetails_OSArchitecture and $n2DigitVersion=14
Rule.Title: Missing registry information will prevent the opening of PowerPoint files in Protected View
Rule.Text: Registry information for PowerPoint is missing. You may not be able to open files in Protected View.

Rule.Name: sBadPPTInterfaceReg2
Rule.Query: (((../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=true() and ../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2='']/Value!='{00020424-0000-0000-C000-000000000046}') or (../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=false()) and $bitness=$OSDetails_OSArchitecture and $n2DigitVersion=14
Rule.Title: Missing registry information will prevent the opening of PowerPoint files in Protected View
Rule.Text: Registry information for PowerPoint is missing. You may not be able to open files in Protected View.

Rule.Name: sBadPPTInterfaceReg3
Rule.Query: (((../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=true() and ../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2='']/Value!='{91493440-5A91-11CF-8700-00AA0060263B}') or (../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=false()) and $bitness=$OSDetails_OSArchitecture and $n2DigitVersion=14
Rule.Title: Missing registry information will prevent the opening of PowerPoint files in Protected View
Rule.Text: Registry information for PowerPoint is missing. You may not be able to open files in Protected View.

Rule.Name: sBadPPTInterfaceReg4
Rule.Query: (((../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Version' and @Key2=''])=true() and ../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Version' and @Key2='']/Value!='2.a') or (../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Version' and @Key2=''])=false()) and $bitness=$OSDetails_OSArchitecture and $n2DigitVersion=14
Rule.Title: Missing registry information will prevent the opening of PowerPoint files in Protected View
Rule.Text: Registry information for PowerPoint is missing. You may not be able to open files in Protected View.

Rule.Title: Missing registry information will prevent the opening of PowerPoint files in Protected View
Rule.Text: Registry information for PowerPoint is missing. You may not be able to open files in Protected View.

Rule.Query: (((../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=true() and ../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2='']/Value!='{00020424-0000-0000-C000-000000000046}') or (../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=false()) and $bitness!=$OSDetails_OSArchitecture and $n2DigitVersion=14
Rule.Title: Missing registry information will prevent the opening of PowerPoint files in Protected View
Rule.Text: Registry information for PowerPoint is missing. You may not be able to open files in Protected View.

Rule.Query: (((../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=true() and ../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2='']/Value!='{91493440-5A91-11CF-8700-00AA0060263B}') or (../Instance/Setting[@Key1='(Default)' and @Key2=''])=false()) and $bitness!=$OSDetails_OSArchitecture and $n2DigitVersion=14

Object.Name: Adobe Flash Player ActiveX control (Shockwave Flash Object)

Rule.Name: sPptFlash1900185ControlError
Rule.Title: Error opening presentations that include a Flash control
Rule.Text:
One or more errors indicating 'PowerPoint found a problem ...' or 'PowerPoint couldn't read some content ...' or 'Some controls can't be activated ...' were detected. These errors can occur when you open a presentation containing a Shockwave Flash Object control and you have Adobe Flash Player 19.0.0.185 installed.
Please update your Adobe Flash Player or click the 'Click here ...' for information on this issue on the Adobe web site.
